description: Borrowed from Spanish tilde, from Latin titulus (“superscript”) or from tildar. Doublet of titer/titre, title, titlo, tittle, and titulus.

entries.meaning: A diacritical mark (˜) placed above a letter to modify its pronunciation, such as by palatalization in Spanish words or nasalization in Portuguese words.
A punctuation mark that indicates range (from a number to another number).
May be used to represent approximation (mathematics).
(logic) The character used to represent negation, usually ~ or ¬.
